Reviews.Title: “Experience India in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TheEco
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in Little India district. It feels like India which means that there are shops that sell traditional Indian clothes and jewelery as well as fruit and vegetables market and 24/7 shops and of course all kinds of traditional Indian restaurants on your every step. The hotel is located about 5-10 min walking from subway station. I saw workers painting the walls of some of the rooms so I guess they are renovating the rooms. Bathroom shower has no curtain so prepare to have flood in your bathroom every time someone takes a shower. They change towels and bed sheets daily. Breakfast is included in the price. They offer toast, butter, marmalade, eggs, bananas and coffee or tea. The staff was quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: The_Travelr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting and tiny. We were in their "best" room and it still made a youth hostel look glamorous. The beds were stained, walls and doors had mold, windows would not shut and let bugs in, and the shower was the washroom so everything gets soaked. The pillows were like sleeping on a bad of potatoes and the mattresses were disgusting. Learn from our mistake and stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, basic, all you could need”
Reviews.Author: Weeza25
Reviews.Content: The best we could find for the money. Small room but big enough for 2 people. Quiet room with good air conditioning, curtains and bathroom facilities. No tea or coffee in rooms. 'Breakfast' the most appalling I have ever experienced - breakfast room cramped, smelly and noisy with no windows, a few scraps of bread, butter, peanut butter and jam, sad-looking blobs of scrambled egg in a tin, sachets of porridge for you to add hot water to, hot water seemingly hidden behind door so left people scrabbling to get to it. The bins were overflowing with plastic bowls and sachets from previous guests breakfasts. Most of the food had disappeared by the time we got there at 10am (probably for the best) so if you really do want to eat there, get there early! It's fine if you are only staying for one night as a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cheap but nothing much”
Reviews.Author: Joonasss
Reviews.Content: Very noisy at the night time cos of the indian punjabi pubs. they play music around 11pm to 5am or so. room was very small and didnt look so clean place at all. bathroom was very moldy and our shower was broke. didnt liked the place atmosphere. good thing was free wireless, good aircon and prize was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “it's very clean !”
Reviews.Author: teddy018
Reviews.Content: pretty reception & very clean hotel! nice hotel to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: alfrednurse
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for many occasions over many years and have to say it has doubled the price but did not make any improvements to the place. It now is just a big rip-off for 130 SGD per night. I wouldnt stay there anymore. Much party and drink noise from the street prevented me from getting any sleep. Madras hotel is not worth the money as it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cheap (in multiple senses) in a noisy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: roaming_pc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is cheap by Singapore standards. The rooms are rather small and even the so called refurbished rooms show signs of age. If you are used to getting a comfortable temperature in the room by just dialing in the temperature, you will be in for a nasty surprise. The a/c doesn't regulate the temperature well. All said, the rooms are poor at best. The staff is generally helpful. The breakfast is minimal; just bread, jam, butter and eggs (if you get it before they run out). The hotel is quite close to the Little India MRT (< 5 min). The worst part about the hotel is the location. Next door is a pub where music is played very loud late into the night on most days. On weekends, it is practically overnight. Opposite to the hotel is a back packer's hostel and they also sometimes have music in the day. It could get Very Noisy. My colleague got a room away from the road and didn't have much issues with noise but the downside is that there is no window. Another thing is that over the weekends, the area around the hotel becomes sort of an open air bar with people sitting in groups on the sidewalks and drinking. They do not cause any problems but not many people would find it comfortable. As with all parts of Little India, this area becomes a Sea of people during the weekend. Again, there are no security or safety issues; just that the place becomes congested. On the whole, I wouldn't pick this hotel again. It would take a Lot of soundproofing to drown out the noise from the street and I don't see them doing it any time soon. Also, any savings in money would be more than offset by the loss of sleep and comfort. There is another hotel on the next street (Perak Hotel) which is a bit costlier but has a decent breakfast and much better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you like small, noisy places with hourly rates.”
Reviews.Author: ChimichangaFreud
Reviews.Content: That's right, hourly rates. Prostitutes going in and out of hotel all day and night. Shady men. AC broke and started shooting water. Didn't matter, because we weren't sleeping from the sound of the club next door. One of the worst hotels I've ever been to. I love the neighborhood (oh that food!), but stay someplace else--really, for $5 more you can stay someplace quite elegant.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but potentially very noisy”
Reviews.Author: FiveOaks55
Reviews.Content: The Madras is cheap and clean but if your staying in a room on the noisy side of the hotel you won't get any sleep. Especially not in the weekends. We had to put up with some Indian singer going at it 'till 3 am. The breakfast is toast and jam in the basement. So if you stay here, request a quite room and you'll be just fine. We paid about a 100 Singapore Dollars for a double room per night.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rinku76
Reviews.Content: good value for money. staff are very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Little India”
Reviews.Author: jakartaboy
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Madras Hotel in Singapore regularly since 2000. Good location in Little India close to vegetarian restaurants. Rooms are clean but spartan. Bathrooms have great hot water with excellent pressure. For clean cheap accommodation with great location cannot be beaten. Don't eat breakfast at hotel. Go to Komala Vilas for dosai or idly. Avoid ground floor rooms as these tend to be used on an hourly basis by local working girls.

HotelInfo.Name: Madras Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.28-32 Madras Street, Singapore 208422, Singapore
